page.title: 09A Tockwith Farm.
page.content: {West Grange Farm, Bilton-in-Ainsty,} a typical farm in our block. {Mr. Pick}lives in a farm house amongst large farm buildings, on his 320 acre farm. He employs 3 men. His biggest field is 28 acres. He uses a 6 year rotation of crops 1.root crop eg sugar beet, potatoes, 2.wheat (for seed), 3.2nd wheat or winter barley, 4.potatoes to be made into KP crisps, 5.wheat (for seed), 6.wheat for cereals. Just now there are approximately 160 acres under wheat, 30 acres of potatoes, 30 acres of sugar beet, and 50 acres of barley. His crops are sprayed frequently with fertilisers, weed killers and pesticides. There is an irrigation scheme on this farm. The water is pumped from a 220ft. bore hole. 13 million gallons are used each year.
